page.title: 07HAYMARKET STATION,EDINBURGH.
page.content:
Although train pessengers might think Haymarket Station is just a grimy structure,it is a listed building.When it was first opened it was the main station on the Edinburgh to Glasgow route.Originally Haymarket was a terminus,but when a tunnel was built to take the line through to Waverley station it became a small secondary station serving the west of Edinburgh.
In steam days the crack locomotives for London bound trains were serviced in the nearby marshalling yards,but now the yards are used for light industry.
In our school we found that out of 58 children in Primary Five,4 come to school by train,using Haymarket Station.
